table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the sound, and not to any letter or glyph.
Namnet på ett ljud, inte en skriven bokstav eller glyf.

table.name: mem
table.column: ناپدید می شود، ناپدید می شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The difference between this word and {loj:v} is that the latter is used for something that incrementally or gradually (though not necessarily slowly) goes away. For example, if a room was full of furniture, and a person left the room and came back later only to find the room empty (and there was no reason to expect this to happen), one might use {ngab:v:nolink} to describe the furniture. If a room was full of boxes that are to be taken somewhere, and then over a short or long time, the boxes are removed, then {loj:v:nolink} could be used once the boxes are all gone.[2]
This word might be used of someone who has beamed away, once that person is gone. To focus on the incremental disappearance of the person, {loj:v} would be appropriate. {DemchoH:v@@Dem:v, -choH:v} might make sense for describing what people see who are watching someone beaming away.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть стабильным, быть устойчивым, быть стойким, быть сбалансированным, быть уравновешенным
This refers to physical stability. To refer to an unstable person, use {ngIj:v}.[1, p.150]
Это слово относится к физической стабильности. Чтобы упомянуть о нестабильном человеке, используйте {ngIj:v}.[1, стр.150]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is probably shortened from {ngaDmeH moQ:n@@ngaD:v, -meH:v, moQ:n} or {ngaDwI' moQ:n@@ngaD:v, -wI':v, moQ:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word can be applied to people as well as animals.[4]
The concept of a "virgin" can be expressed by literally saying what a virgin is, e.g., {pagh ngaghpu'bogh be':n@@pagh:n:1, ngagh:v, -pu':v, -bogh:v, be':n} or {not vay' ngaghpu'bogh be':n@@not:adv, vay':n, ngagh:v, -pu':v, -bogh:v, be':n}.

Tätä sanaa käytetään sekä ihmisistä että eläimistä.[4]
"Neitsyyden" käsite voidaan ilmaista selittämällä se: {pagh ngaghpu'bogh be':n@@pagh:n:1, ngagh:v, -pu':v, -bogh:v, be':n} tai {not vay' ngaghpu'bogh be':n@@not:adv, vay':n, ngagh:v, -pu':v, -bogh:v, be':n}.[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object of this verb is the thing that you squeeze, for example, {Ha'on vevwI':n} or {nIqDob:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a made-up puzzle or riddle.
{ngaj:v} and {run:v} make two "shorts". Will Shortz is a famous creator of puzzles. See also {wIl:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara seg, vara läderaktig (i konsistensen), vara fast (ha tuggmotstånd)
This is the Cantonese word for "bite" or "chew" (咬).

table.name: mem
table.column: The thing that's being stuck to is marked with {-Daq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The object is made to stick to something else, which is marked with {-Daq:n}.
This was used in the explanation of {ngam:v} and is given its own entry for convenience.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Latin word "gluten" means "to stick" ({ngam:v}). The presence of gluten may be important in restaurants ({Qe':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: A word ending in {-ngan:sen:nolink} is generally translated "people of (place)" or something like that, but can more generally just indicate a group of beings, not necessarily beings from a specific place.[2] For example, {vulqangan:n} refers to a "person of Vulcan", but {qelpIngan:n} is not known to be based on a place name.

table.name: mem
table.column: poiketa, erota (normaalista), vaihdella; olla poikkeava, eroava, olla vaihteleva
This verb is used to express that something is varying or deviating from the norm, or is fluctuating so much that there isn't a norm.

table.name: mem
table.column: The two instances of {ng:sen:nolink} straddle the {a:sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used in the sense of musical consonance or sympathetic vibrations.

table.name: mem
table.column: be locked, be sealed, be secured, be fastened
قفل شده باشد، مهر و موم شود، محافظت شود، بسته شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara låst, vara förseglad, vara säkrad, vara fäst
быть заблокированным, быть запечатанным, быть закрепленным, быть закрепленным [AUTOTRANSLATED]
olla lukittu, olla sinetöity, olla kiinnitetty
être verrouillé, être scellé, être sécurisé, être attaché [AUTOTRANSLATED]

There is an idiomatic expression, {ngaQ lojmIt:sen}, which means that an outcome is unavoidable or a course of action irrevocable.
For "locking" onto a target, see {'uch:v:2}, and also consider {buS:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: قفل ، مهر و موم ، ایمن ، بست [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: خروج از سیستم، خروج از سیستم [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is an extension of the meaning of {ngaQmoH:v:1} applied to accounts ({mab:n:2}).
One can say {mab ngaQmoH:sen@@mab:n:2, ngaQmoH:v:2} and so on, but this is a special argot or frozen form. It may have been shortened from an earlier phrase, such as {mab Hung lojmIt ngaQmoH:sen@@mab:n:2, Hung:n, lojmIt:n, ngaQmoH:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column: باز کردن ، ناشناخته بودن ، ناامن بودن ، باز کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
desbloquear, destravar, retirar o selo, desatar, soltar

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an extension of the meaning of {ngaQHa'moH:v:1} applied to accounts ({mab:n:2}).

table.name: mem
table.column: For something like a keycard, some Klingon speakers unofficially use {lojmIt chaw':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression means that a situation has an unavoidable outcome, or a plan or commitment is firm and cannot be changed.

table.name: mem
table.column: be miraculous, be supernatural, be wondrous
معجزه آسا، فوقالعاده، شگفت انگیز باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser milagroso, ser sobrenatural, ser maravilhoso
sois miraculeux, sois surnaturel, sois merveilleux [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object is the thing being contained. {-Daq:n:suff} is unnecessary.[2]
Объектом является вещь, которая содержится внутри. {-Daq:n:suff} необязателен.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is actually a sentence meaning "the case contains". It was used as the heading for the Klingon version of the list of the {Klingon Monopoly:src} game box's "contents".
In comparison, the table of contents of a book would be labeled {paq 'ay'mey:n}.[2]
There is a typo on the box: it actually says {naS 'aplo':sen:nolink}, but it's clear what was meant.

table.name: mem
table.column: The three key ingredients needed to make this are {DIl'on:n}, {ghav:n}, and {no'negh:n}.
Gunpowder was discovered in China during the Tang dynasty.

table.name: mem
table.column: غضروف غربالگری خوراکی (برای آماده سازی غذا) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
herbed顆粒軟骨（用於食物準備） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
cartilage granulé aux herbes (pour la préparation des aliments) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is mixed with {tIr:n} and used to {pID:v:1} food.[1, p.89]
The Japanese word "karaage" (唐揚げ), referring to food prepared this way, has Tang (as in the Chinese dynasty) as its first character.

table.name: mem
table.column: pitkästä kirjoittamisesta johtuva sormien lihasten kouristus?
An instance of linguist humour. This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}, where it would've been separated by the word "write" from "worsen" and "worthless".

table.name: mem
table.column: grande criatura parecida com um canino
eräs suuri koiran tai suden kaltainen eläin
grande créature ressemblant à un chien [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is like the creatures that accompany the guards on {rura' pente':n}.
Backwards, this is "White Fang", the name of the eponymous wolfdog in Jack London's novel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not what rust does; this is what water, wind, and so on do.
Das bedeutet nicht "rosten", sondern das, was Wasser und Wind machen.

table.name: mem
table.column: mixing stick with flattened, paddlelike end
چوب مخلوط کردن با انتهای پهن و پد مانند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
палочка для смешивания с плоским концом [AUTOTRANSLATED]
混合棒與扁平的槳狀末端 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
lasta; sekoitustikku, jossa on litteä ja leveä pää
bâton mélangeur avec extrémité aplatie en forme de pagaie [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is a {DuDwI':n} with a paddlelike end.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a kind of Klingon work pants, which may be similar to jeans (see {jIn yopwaH:n}).
Written partially in "xifan hol", this is "fayvo'wan" or "501", which is a style of Levi's jeans. (The {qaghwI':n} would be written as "z" in pure "xifan hol".)

table.name: mem
table.column: An English definition has never been given for this word. Its meaning is inferred from the only example of its usage.
▶ {wo' ngay' bochoqmeH bowIvlu'pu'!:sen:nolink} "You have been chosen to preserve the glory of the Empire!"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject of this verb is all the involved parties.
Das Subjekt dieses Verbs sind alle Beteiligten.
Tällä verbillä ei ole objektia, vaan monikollinen subjekti sisältää kaikki osapuolet.

The gloss is actually given as "sex (i.e., perform sex; always subject)", which was considered by some to be unclear. The interpretation that this verb indicates that the subject, which must be plural, are engaged in sexual intercourse with each other, was confirmed by MO in July 2013, after its use in a poster for Stonewall's "Some People Are Gay. Get Over It." campaign.

table.name: mem
table.column: be counterfeit, be false, be fake
vara förfalskad, vara falsk, vara oäkta
быть поддельным, быть подложным, быть ложным, быть ошибочным, быть подставным, быть липовым
olla väärennetty, olla epäaito, olla väärä
être contrefait, être faux, être falsifié

table.name: mem
table.column: Aufgrund der eigentlichen Bedeutung ({ngech:n:1}) bezieht sich dieses Wort eindeutig auf den Bereich zwischen den Brüsten, was auch das deutsche Wort Busen bedeutet. Das Wort Dekolletee wird im Deutschen häufig in euphemistischer Weise auf die Brust selbst bezogen. Es ist kein Synonym für Busen.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть лёгким, быть спокойным, быть нетрудным, быть непринужденным

table.name: mem
table.column: käydä kauppaa laittomilla tavaroilla, harjoittaa mustanpörssin kauppaa
This means to trade in something illegal. The object is the allegedly illicit item.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: привлекать, притягивать, влечь, манить, прельщать, прельстить, приманивать, завлекать, соблазнять
To express what was done to bait someone, use this verb with {-meH:v}, e.g., "use a spaceship in order to lure/attract/tempt them".
Чтобы выразить, что было сделано, чтобы завлечь кого-то, используйте этот глагол с {-meH:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {tlhab; ngem Ha'DIbaH rur@@tlhab:v, ngem Ha'DIbaH:n, rur:v}.[1, p.132]
Есть идиома, {tlhab; ngem Ha'DIbaH rur@@tlhab:v, ngem Ha'DIbaH:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression means that something is complex. It is often used in the form {ngem Sarghmey tlha'laH:sen:nolink} to describe someone who is capable of a difficult feat.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is said of body parts. For emotional numbness, use {jemHa':v@@jem:v, -Ha':v} or {jemlaHbe':v@@jem:v, -laH:v, -be':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The difference between this and a {bIQ'a':n} is that a lake is completely surrounded by land.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers specifically to the shore of a lake. The shore of an ocean would be called a {bIQ'a' HeH:n}, and so on.
In the {paq'batlh:src}, the expression {qul ngeng HeH:n:nolink} is used to refer to the shore of the {qul ngeng:n} inside {QIStaq:n}, where the environment is so hostile to life that not even {tlheng'IQ:n} would grow.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a giant mythical creature which {qortar:n} fought for a day.[1]

The origin of this word appears to be a mistranslation by Bing translator, which turns "sea creature" into {ngeng roQ:sen:nolink} (with a space). This was then retroactively "vetted" by Marc Okrand after the book's publication.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: переопределять, отменять, отвергать, попирать, задавить, переехать кого-то

table.name: mem
table.column: پله ها، راه پله ها (به استثنای درب کشتی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
escadas, escadas (exceto na porta do navio)
escaliers, escalier (sauf à la porte du navire) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
In some {meqro'vaq Sep:n} dialects, this refers to any stairway but a {choghvat:n:1}, which is called a {letlh:n:2} there.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used for the act of moving or putting things somewhere to store them. There is a subtle difference between this and {pol:v}, which refers to just keeping something somewhere. For example, {Soj Dangeq:sen@@Soj:n:1, Da-:v, ngeq:v} might be said to someone putting groceries into the food storage room ({Soj polmeH pa':n}). But {Soj Dapol:sen@@Soj:n:1, Da-:v, pol:v} might be said to someone whose groceries are already in the storage room.[1]
This is also used with {qaw:n} idiomatically to refer to memorization (see {ngeq qaw:sen}). Once the thing is memorized, {pol:v:nolink} might make more sense. Both of these words are also used in the computer sense to mean "save" or "store" a file on a storage medium.[1]

Dies wird verwendet, wenn man Sachen irgendwo hinlegt, um sie dort zu lagern. Es gibt einen feinen Unterscheid zwischen dies und {pol:v}, welches sich nur auf den Verbleib der Sachen irgendwo bezieht. Zum Beispiel kann man {Soj Dangeq:sen@@Soj:n:1, Da-:v, ngeq:v} zu jemandem sagen, der gerade seine Einkäufe in die Speisekammer legt ({Soj polmeH pa':n}). Aber {Soj Dapol:sen@@Soj:n:1, Da-:v, pol:v} sagt man zu jemandem, wenn die Speisen bereits im Schrank liegen.[1]
Das Verb kann auch in Kombination mit {qaw:n} verwendet werden im Sinne von auswendig lernen (siehe {ngeq qaw:sen}). Sobald man sich aber etwas gemerkt hat, ist {pol:v:nolink} wohl passender. Beide Verben können verwendet werden, wenn es darum geht, Daten auf einem Computer oder ähnlich zu speichern.[1]
▶ {ghuQ ngeqpu' qawwIj:sen@@ghuQ:n, ngeq:v, -pu':v, qaw:n, -wIj:n} "I've memorized the poem" (literally, "my memory has stored the poem")
▶ {ghuQ ngeqpu' qawwIj:sen@@ghuQ:n, ngeq:v, -pu':v, qaw:n, -wIj:n} "Ich habe das Gedicht gelernt" (wörtlich, "mein Gedächtnis hat das Gedicht eingelagert")

table.name: mem
table.column: memorize (commit to memory), save (in storage medium)
sich merken (im Gedächtnis speichern), speichern (im Speichermedium)
حفظ کردن (تعهد به حافظه)، ذخیره (در محیط ذخیره سازی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
記憶（提交到內存中），保存（在存儲介質中） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
memorizar (confirmar na memória), salvar (no meio de armazenamento) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
mémoriser (enregistrer en mémoire), enregistrer (sur un support de stockage) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is an idiom referring to committing something to memory. Once something is memorized, {pol:v} would be used to refer to keeping it there. Both of these expressions are also used in the computer sense to mean "save" or "store" a file on a storage medium.[1]
▶ {ghuQ ngeqpu' qawwIj:sen@@ghuQ:n, ngeq:v, -pu':v, qaw:n, -wIj:n} "I've memorized the poem" (literally, "my memory has stored the poem")
▶ {ghuQ ngeqpu' qawwIj:sen@@ghuQ:n, ngeq:v, -pu':v, qaw:n, -wIj:n} "Ich habe das Gedicht gelernt" (wörtlich, "mein Gedächtnis hat das Gedicht eingelagert")

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an electronic component capable of storing energy in an electric field.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: bump into, run into, collide with
با دست و پا زدن، با آنها برخورد کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
stöta på, springa in i, kollidera med
se cogner, se heurter, entrer en collision avec [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This describes the collision of something moving with something stationary.[1] Unlike {paw':v:1}, {ngeQ:v:nolink} has an innocent party.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for a theory in the scientific sense.

table.name: mem
table.column: cuire au four (le sujet est la nourriture) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is what the bread or pizza does.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is what a person does to produce bread, cakes, or pizza.[1]
The most common way to refer to a baker is {vutwI':n} preceded, if need be, by {tIr ngogh:n} or {chab:n:1} or whatever, but {ngeSmoHwI':n@@ngeSmoH:v, -wI':v} is possible.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Something on loan will "cause trouble" ({Seng:v}) if it is misplaced ({chIl:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: The definition was given as just "interest". The "money" part was added for clarification.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a physics term referring to the spreading out of a beam or waves by contact with a narrow aperture or substance.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word refers to a person, although it can be used to translate the word "store" or "shop" in context, in the sense that in Klingon, one says that one is going to the pharmacist rather than to the pharmacy.
In {TNK:src}, "Where is the shop?" is translated as {nuqDaq ghaH ngevwI''e'?:sen:nolink} (literally, "Where is the seller?") Note that {ghaH:n} is used rather than {'oH:n}.

Это слово относится к лицу, хотя может быть переведено, как магазин.
В {TNK:src}, "Где находится магазин?" переведено, как {nuqDaq ghaH ngevwI''e'?:sen:nolink} Заметьте, что {ghaH:n} предпочтительней, чем {'oH:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: مچ پا (همچنین یک اصطلاح عامیانه از تخلیه) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is also a slang term of deprecation ({ngIb:n:2}).
This is listed in the {KGT:src} word lists as "ankle (also a slang term of deprecation)". The two meanings have been split into separate entries for consistency with other slang terms.

table.name: mem
table.column: This slang meaning was influenced by the Krotmag pronunciation of {ngIb:n:1}, which sounds like {ngIm:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal (weird animal found on {Qo'noS:n} that looks like a rock)
seltsames Tier, das auf {Qo'noS:n} vorkommt und wie ein Stein aussieht
حیوان عجیبی در {Qo'noS:n} پیدا شد که شبیه سنگ است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
konstigt djur hittat på {Qo'noS:n} som ser ut som en sten [AUTOTRANSLATED]
на {Qo'noS:n} найдено странное животное, похожее на камень [AUTOTRANSLATED]
在 {Qo'noS:n} 上發現的奇怪的動物，看起來像一塊石頭 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
animal estranho encontrado em {Qo'noS:n} que se parece com uma rocha
type d'animal (animal étrange trouvé sur {Qo'noS:n} qui ressemble à un rocher) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
It can suddenly open up and stick out something and grab a piece of food (like a frog does with flies). It doesn't do this very frequently, as it's not hungry very often.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: vara bråkig, vara stökig, vara oregerlig, vara bångstyrig
olla rähinöivä, levoton, olla kuriton, tottelematon
This is a standard verb that is close in meaning to the slang expression {Duj ngaDHa':n}.[1, p.150]

table.name: mem
table.column: Based on the {SkyBox S21:src} example, this means "have the courage to do something", rather than "provoke or challenge someone".
Пример, основанный на {SkyBox S21:src}, скорее означает "иметь мужество сделать что-то", нежели "провоцировать или вызвать кого-то на соревнование".
The example appears to be missing a conjunction.

▶ {yIntaHbogh tlhIngan Soj tlhol jablu'DI' tIvqu'lu'. qagh, ro'qegh'Iwachab, targh tIq Sop 'e' lungIl Humanpu' puS.:sen:nolink} "Klingon food is best when served fresh and live. Few humans dare to eat gagh, rokeg blood pie, or heart of targ."[2]

▶ {yIntaHbogh tlhIngan Soj tlhol jablu'DI' tIvqu'lu'. qagh, ro'qegh'Iwachab, targh tIq Sop 'e' lungIl Humanpu' puS.:sen:nolink} "Клингонская еда лучше всего подаётся свежей и живой. Несколько человек осмелились съесть гагх, кровяной пирог, или сердце тарга."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: be negatively charged, have a negative charge
شارژ منفی، شارژ منفی داشته باشید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara negativt laddad, ha en negativ laddning [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть отрицательно заряженным, иметь отрицательный заряд [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ter uma carga negativa, ser carregado negativamente
être chargé négativement, avoir une charge négative [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was defined as "have a negative charge" in the {qep'a' 23 (2016):src} booklet, but was confirmed to be stative afterwards.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara rutten, vara äcklig, vara vidrig
быть гнилым, быть вонючим, быть мерзким

table.name: mem
table.column: заимствовать, занимать, одалживать, брать на время, давать взаймы

This word is used in {TNK:src} in the sentence {nuqDaq puH Duj vIngIp?:sen:nolink} to mean "Where can I hire (rent) a car?" However, it's not clear that the Klingon sentence expresses the idea that the car is to be borrowed for money.

Слово использовано в {TNK:src} в предложении {nuqDaq puH Duj vIngIp?:sen:nolink}, которое означает "Где я могу взять машину напрокат?" Тем не менее, не совсем ясно, что Клингонское предложение выражает идею, что машина взята напрокат за деньги.

table.name: mem
table.column: Based on the request, this can be used either for bread dough or sore muscles.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This noun indicates that a single thing is being considered apart from others, or that a sequence of identical things is considered one after another. Like {Hoch:n} and {'op:n}, it precedes what it modifies.[4]
{ngIq:n:nolink} is always followed by a noun which is not explicitly plural. In contexts where it refers to multiple things, it can be translated as "each X". When {Hoch:n:nolink} precedes a noun which isn't explicitly plural, it also means "each X". The difference is that {Hoch:n:nolink} focuses on things as members of a group, whereas {ngIq:n:nolink} focuses on the individual things. It's a subtle difference, but a difference nonetheless. In such contexts, {ngIq:n:nolink} has a sequential meaning (whereas {Hoch:n:nolink} does not).[4]
In some contexts, {ngIq:n:nolink} can be translated as "single" or "individual", but it always implies that there are (or could be) other similar things. For example, {ngIq tonSaw':n:nolink} means "one single move" in the sense of "one single move out of several". That is, {ngIq:n:nolink} is used to focus on one move in particular.[4]

In an article writtten for the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src} booklet, MO wrote that "The description of {ngIq:n:nolink} in {boQwI':n:nolink} is pretty good". This is preserved in the first paragraph in the notes.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a type of lubricant used on disruptor cannons.[1]

The fact that this is used on disruptor cannons comes from the glossary to {Honor Bound:src}.
For a very long time, this was an unofficial word, but it was confirmed by Okrand for a translation of The Wizard of Oz.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: monter, chevaucher; aller à cheval, vélo, moto

This is the verb used for riding a bicycle (or motorcycle, or horse, where the rider is controlling, to one degree or another, the motion of the vehicle or means of conveyance). The verb {lIgh:v} would be used for a second person (a passenger).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: stringed instrument which is bowed, violin
ساز زهی که تعظیم می شود ، ویولن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
instrumento de cordas que é curvado, violino
instrument à cordes à archet, violon [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is a kind of stringed instrument played with a {ngItHel naQ:n@@ngItHel:n, naQ:n:1} (a "bow", i.e., a stick strung with strands). A slang term often used for the "bow" is {yan:n}. The closest Terran analogue is probably a violin.

Tämä on eräs kielisoitin, jota soitetaan "jousella", eli kepillä, johon on kiinnitetty jänne ({ngItHel naQ:n@@ngItHel:n, naQ:n:1}). Jousta kutsutaan slangissa usein "miekaksi" ({yan:n}). Maapallon soittimista se muistuttaa eniten viulua.

When written in "xifan hol", {ngItHel:n:nolink} is "fithel", which is a Middle English form of "fiddle".
One of these was used in the production of the opera {'u':src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This describes situations like when your car is stuck in the snow, or Santa is stuck in the chimney, or a ring is stuck on your finger, or a nail is stuck in a piece of wood and you can't pull it out.
This was defined as "be stuck" with an explanation, along with a bunch of other words which can be translated into various senses of "be stuck" in English.

table.name: mem
table.column: патрулировать, осуществлять патрулирование, стоять в дозоре
▶ {tlhIlHal yIngIv!} "Patrol the mine!"[2, p.191] ▶ {jogh veH lungIv.} "They patrol the quadrant border."[2, p.194]
▶ {tlhIlHal yIngIv!} "Патрулируйте шахту!"[2, стр.191] ▶ {jogh veH lungIv.} "Они патрулируют границу квадранта."[2, p.194]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is also used to express "pressurized" (as in what happens inside an airplane cabin). Air pressure would usually be expressed in units of {chebmey:n@@cheb:n, -mey:n} per {morgh:n}. To indicate that the air pressure is correct, the expression is {ngI'chu' muD:sen@@ngI':v, -chu':v, muD:n:1} or {ngI'chu' lay:sen@@ngI':v, -chu':v, lay:n:2h}. To indicate that this is the result of a process, one might say {ngI'choHchu'pu' muD:sen@@ngI':v, -choH:v, -chu':v, -pu':v, muD:n:1}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a part of female anatomy.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'.:sen:nolink} "There, the leaders of the Klingon High Council meet to determine policy and decide upon the fate of the Empire."[2]
▶ {ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'.:sen:nolink} "Здесь лидеры Клингонского высшего совета встречаются, чтобы определить политику и решать судьбу империи."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Three kinds of quarks are named "strange" ({Huj:v:1}), "up", and "down" ({chong:v:1} means "vertical").

table.name: mem
table.column: چیزهای بی اهمیت، واقعیت بی اهمیت [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Trekbits" was translated as {Hov leng ngoDHommey:n:nolink} in {STC 104:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a person who assembles bricks into something, such as a wall or a building.

table.name: mem
table.column: pillow (soft head support not used by Klingons)
oreiller (appui-tête souple non utilisé par les Klingons) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons don't have pillows, but Maltz said this is what he would call one if he had to call it something.
Клингоны не имеют подушек, но Мальц сказал, что это то, что он бы этим назвал, если бы ему пришлось как-то это назвать.

table.name: mem
table.column: мазок, пятно, вязкое вещество, липкое вещество
This is one possible verb to use with {watrIn:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: رنگ با استفاده از انگشتان دست [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть беспокойным, быть неспокойным, быть неугомонным, быть тревожным

table.name: mem
table.column: move bat'leth from horizontal to vertical orientation
Bat'leth von waagerechte in senkrechte Position drehen
حرکت بتال از جهت افقی به عمودی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
förflytta en bat'leth från horisontell till vertikal position
перемещение батлета из горизонтального положения в вертикальное
將bat'leth從水平移動到垂直方向 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
mover bat'leth da orientação horizontal para a vertical
déplacer Bat'leth de l'orientation horizontale à la verticale [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be the object of {mI':v}.[1]
Tätä sanaa voi käyttää verbin {mI':v} objektina.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word describes someone who is really into something and knows a lot about it, but doesn't necessarily partake in related activities.
Это слово описывает кого-то, кто глубоко разбирается в каком-то предмете и много знает, но совершенно необязательно, что принимает участие в связанных мероприятиях.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word describes someone who is really into something and knows a lot about it, but doesn't necessarily partake in related activities.
Это слово описывает кого-то, кто глубоко разбирается в каком-то предмете и много знает, но совершенно необязательно, что принимает участие в связанных мероприятиях.

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject of {ngon:v:nolink} (for example a liquid such as boiling water) produces or forms bubbles. A person blowing through a straw into a glass of water to make bubbles would be the subject of {ngonmoH:v@@ngon:v, -moH:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is often the object of {SIQ:v} to express the idea of "be nostalgic".
Dies ist häufig das Objekt von {SIQ:v} um "nostalgisch sein" auszudrücken.
When written in "xifan hol", this is "fonder", as in "absence makes the heart grow fonder".

table.name: mem
table.column: See under {ngongmeH Duj:n} for some background information about the example sentence.
▶ {ngongmeH wa' DujDaq nuHmey nISbe'bogh So'wI' jomlu'pu'.:sen:nolink} "A cloaking device that doesn't interfere with weapons has been installed on one ship in order to experiment."[1; 2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined as "goal" in {TKD:src} and as "purpose" in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: растворить, растворять, аннулировать, расторгать, разлагать, разводить

The subject of this verb is the thing which is undergoing dissolution.
This word is also found in the archaic expression {ngoS tlhogh cha:sen:nolink} (see {tlhogh:n}), which is said during the ritual of divorce.[2]

Субъектом этого глагола является вещь, которая подвергается расторжению.
Это слово также найдено в архаичном выражении {ngoS tlhogh cha:sen:nolink} (смотрите {tlhogh:n}), которое сказано во время ритуала развода.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: In some contexts, it's more common to express the location (stated in units of {lawrI'(mey):n@@lawrI':n, -mey:n}, though the word itself is optional) followed by {ngotrI':n:nolink} and/or {lungrI':n} without a verb. This is a form of clipped Klingon.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the imaginary lines used in determining coordinates (or the actual lines drawn on a map or similar image).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: linha do mapa (sistema de coordenadas tradicional) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ligne de carte (système de coordonnées traditionnel) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: coordenada do mapa (sistema de coordenadas tradicional) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: لغزش ، دست و پا زدن ، پیچیدن ، خم کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
glisser, se tortiller, se tortiller, se tordre [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This means to move like a snake.[1]
Based on the request, this is a verb of locomotion for snakes, bugs, and animals generally low to the ground.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть ответственным, быть сознательным, быть несущим ответственность
This means "be accountable, be answerable". It can also be used in the sense of "be trustworthy, sensible, dependable". There is some overlap in meaning with {rang:v}.[2]
Это означает "быть подотчетным, держать ответ". Также может использоваться в смысле "быть достойным доверия, быть здравомыслящим, быть надёжным".[2]
▶ {ghom ngoy':n} ▶ {vangDI' tlhIngan SuvwI' ngoy' qorDu'Daj; vangDI' qorDu'Daj ngoy' tlhIngan SuvwI'.:sen}
be accountable, be answerable, be trustworthy, be sensible, be dependable

table.name: mem
table.column:
Note that in Klingon, there is a different word for "be old (not new)" ({ngo':v:nolink}) than for "be old (not young)" ({qan:v:1}).
This word is applied to objects or ideas.[2]

Заметьте, что в Клингонском языке есть отдельное слово для "быть старым (не новым)" ({ngo':v:nolink}). Оно применяется для объектов или идей.
Для того, чтобы сказать "быть старым (не молодым)", используйте ({qan:v:1}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: To specify immigration or emigration, the suffixes {-Daq:n:suff} and {-vo':n:suff} would be used on the destination or area of departure.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: тогда, затем, потом, в это время

This adverbial is used mainly to emphasize that one event occurred at the same time as another. It does not mean "at some (vague) time in the past" or "at some (unknown) time in the future".[1]
For a verb with a similar meaning, see {quq:v}. For an idiom meaning "by that time", see {pumDI':sen}.
Note that "then" in the sense of "subsequently" is {ghIq:adv}.[1]

Данное наречие главным образом используется, чтобы сделать акцент на том, что одно событие имело место быть в тоже самое время, когда и другое. Это не означает "некоторое неопределенное время в прошлом" или "некоторое неизвестное время в будущем".[1]
Для глагола, с похожим значением, смотрите {quq:v}. Для идиомы, означающей "к тому времени", смотрите {pumDI':sen}.
Заметьте, что "тогда" в смысле "впоследствии" будет {ghIq:adv}.[1]
▶ {DungluQ tIHIv. ngugh Qongbe' chaH.:sen:nolink} "Attack them at noon! They won't be sleeping then."[1]
▶ {DungluQ tIHIv. ngugh Qongbe' chaH.:sen:nolink} "Атакуйте их в полдень! Тогда они не будут спать."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Hung", as in a jury, or a convict.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a person who testifies in court.

table.name: mem
table.column: If a bird lands on land, the verb {Saq:v} is used, and if on water, then {tlhot:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: authority, power, one in authority or in charge
اقتدار، قدرت، یکی در مقام یا مسئول [AUTOTRANSLATED]
auktoritet, befogenhet, makt, någon med auktoritet eller i
авторитет, власть, один во власти или ответственный [AUTOTRANSLATED]
auktoriteetti, valta, vallassa tai johdossa oleva henkilö
autorité, pouvoir, personne en situation d'autorité ou commandante

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the faction that controls most of the Gamma Quadrant.
Относится к фракции, что контроллирует большую часть Гамма Квадранта.

table.name: mem
table.column: be arrogant, be haughty, be conceited
vara arrogant, vara inbilsk, vara högfärdig, vara egenkär
olla ylimielinen, kopea, koppava, itserakas, ylpeä
être arrogant, être hautain, être vaniteux

table.name: mem
table.column: There is no "upper case" or "lower case" in the Klingon writing system. {ngutlh tIn:n@@ngutlh:n, tIn:v} and {ngutlh mach:n@@ngutlh:n, mach:v} can be used for these, respectively.[2]
This was defined as "letter, written character". The additional definition "glyph" comes from {jItuj'ep ngutlh:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: For "bold", {pI':v} may be used. For "italics", {chongHa':v@@chong:v:1, -Ha':v} may be used.

table.name: mem
table.column: If a writing system has a name, that can be used instead of {ngutlhmey:n@@ngutlh:n, -mey:n}, e.g., {pIqaD qa' DIvI' Hol ngutlhmey:sen:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: be dyed, be stained, be tinted
رنگ آمیزی شود، رنگ شود، رنگ شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara färgad, vara fläckad, vara tonad

This word is seldom used except in the question {chay' nguv?:sen:nolink} or when suffixed with {-moH:v} to form {nguvmoH:v}.[1, p.82]
Besides {chIS:v} and {qIj:v}, there are only two known color words in Klingon, {Doq:v} and {SuD:v:1}. The latter two words are suffixed with {-qu':v}, and/or combined with {wov:v} and {Hurgh:v}, to refer to more specific colors. To be even more specific, comparisons are used, such as {Doq 'ej Qaj wuS rur:sen}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A slang way to say this is {Sen:v:2}.

Written in "xifan hol", this is "fuy". "Fooey" (or "phooey") is an expression of disdain.
The intransitivity of this verb was confirmed during the Q & A session. The target of the scoffing would have to be indicated for example with {-Daq:n:suff}.

table.name: mem
table.column: A "what" question in English is often best translated into Klingon using the imperative form of this or a similar verb.[2]
Вопрос "что" часто лучше всего переводится на Клингонский, используя форму повелительного наклонения этого или похожего глагола.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This may also be translated as "grime" in a non-technical context.[1]
